question: The book of Nehemiah was the words of Nehemiah who was the son of ________ (Neh 1:1)?
Where was Nehemiah when he was informed about the remnant of the exiles and Jerusalem (Neh 1:1)
What month was it when Nehemiah was informed about the remnant of the exiles and Jerusalem (Neh 1:1)?
Who initially brought Nehemiah word about Jerusalem (Neh 1:2)?
choice: Shelemiah, the son of Jozadak the priest

question: Besides Jerusalem what did Hanani inform Nehemiah about (Neh 1:2)?
choice: The Gihon spring had been stopped up
The exiles had been attacked by their enemies
The remnant who survived the exile

question: Why were the exiles in great trouble and disgrace (Neh 1:3)?
choice: The walls of Jerusalem were broken down
The temple had been burned to the ground
The people were worshipping the gods of the land

question: What did Hanani tell Nehemiah was destroyed in Jerusalem besides the walls (Neh 1:3)?
When Nehemiah heard that the walls of Jerusalem had been broken down his response was all of the following EXCEPT (Neh 1:4)?
In his initial prayer Nehemiah addressed God in all of the following ways EXCEPT (Neh 1:5)?
In Nehemiah’s initial prayer he says, what does God keep with those who obey his commands (Neh 1:5)?
With whom does God keep his covenant of love (Neh 1:5)?
choice: Those who do not go after other gods
Those who love him and keep his commands

question: In his initial prayer Nehemiah identifies the people of Israel as _________ (Neh 1:6)
What did Nehemiah pray would be open to hear his prayer (Neh 1:6)?
Besides his own sins and the Israelites whose sins did Nehemiah confess (Neh 1:6)?
choice: The sins of the remnant of the exiles
The sins of his father’s house
The sins of Abraham, Isaac and Jacob
The sins of those dwelling in Susa

question: In Nehemiah’s initial prayer what did he confess (Neh 1:6)?
choice: The rebellion of the Israelites at Susa
Sins of the kings of Israel and Judah
His sins and the sins of his father’s house
He did not know what to do

question: To whom does Nehemiah identify as the one to whom God gave his commands (Neh 1:7)?
In the instruction God gave to Moses what did it say would happen if Israel was unfaithful (Neh 1:8)?
choice: They would be scattered among the nations
They would suffer the plagues of Egypt
Their walls would be broken down and their cities burned

question: One what condition would God regarter his exiled people (Neh 1:9)?
choice: If they rebuilt the temple and walls of Jerusalem
If they returned to God and obeyed his commands
If they put away their foreign gods and followed God alone

question: What would God do if those exiled among the nations returned to God and obeyed his commands (Neh 1:9)?
choice: He would rebuild the walls of Jerusalem and fortify its gates
He would never again drive them from the land of their fathers
He would gather them to the place he chose as a dwelling for his Name

question: Where would God regather his people if they returned to him and obeyed his commands (Neh 1:9)?
choice: To the temple where he dwells
To the place he chose as a dwelling for his Name
To the land he promised to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob
To the land flowing with milk and honey

question: What had God done for his people by his mighty strength and mighty hand (Neh 1:10)?
choice: Saved them from the hand of Pharaoh
Regathered them from among the nations

question: To what did Nehemiah request God be attentive (Neh 1:10)?
choice: The prayer of his servants who reverence his name
The confession of sin of his people who were in exile
The tears of those who were seeking the Lord
The plight of Jerusalem whose walls had been broken down

question: In Nehemiah’s initial prayer what did he say those servants of the Lord who prayed delighted in (Neh 1:11)?
choice: To help the fatherless and widows

question: To which Persian king did Nehemiah present wine (Neh 2:1)?
What did Nehemiah take and give to the Persian King Artaxerxes (Neh 2:1)?
What did Artaxerxes ask Nehemiah about (Neh 2:2)?
choice: How the exiles in Jerusalem were doing
What group of people he belonged to
Why Israel had not paid their tribute to him

question: How did Nehemiah identify Jerusalem when Artaxerxes asked him why he was so sad (Neh 2:3)?
choice: As the city of the Great King
As the city where his fathers were buried
As the mountain of the Most High

question: What part of Jerusalem did Nehemiah mention to Artaxerxes when he asked him why he [Nehemiah] was so sad (Neh 2:3)?
choice: The streets are filled with blood and violence
The gates were destroyed by fire

question: What did Nehemiah do just prior to telling Artaxerxes he wanted to go to the city where his fathers were buried (Neh 2:5)?
choice: He wrote his request on a tablet

question: What did Nehemiah tell Artaxerxes he wanted to do (Neh 2:5)?
choice: Restore the gates of the city
Build the temple the the Most High

question: What did Artaxerxes with his queen sitting beside him ask Nehemiah (Neh 2:6)?
choice: Why he wanted to make the journey
How long his journey would take
How many soldiers he would require  to help him

question: What did Nehemiah want from Artaxerxes to provide him with safe conduct until he arrived in Judah (Neh 2:7)?
choice: Food and water for the trip
Letters to the governors of Trans-Euphrates

question: Nehemiah wanted letters to be written to what group in order to secure safe passage to Judah (Neh 2:7)?
choice: The kings of Haran and Ugarit
The satraps of Aram and Gilead
The rulers of Syria and Lebanon

question: Nehemiah requested Artaxerxes write a letter to ________ who was over the king’s forest for timber for beams (Neh 2:8)?
Nehemiah request timbers for all of the following as part of the rebuilding efforts EXCEPT  (Neh 2:8)?
Nehemiah asked Artaxerxes the Persian king to send a letter to Asaph requesting what to aid in his rebuilding project (Neh 2:8)?
Why did the king grant Nehemiah’s requests (Neh 2:8)?
choice: Because the king looked with favor on Nehemiah
Because the king was seeking the favor of the God of Israel
Because the gracious hand of God was upon him
Because God moved the heart of King Artaxerxes

question: Who did the Persian King Artaxerxes send with Nehemiah (Neh 2:9)?
choice: 10 talents of gold and 50 talents of silver

question: What two fellows were disturbed that Nehemiah was coming to promote the welfare of the Israelites (Neh 2:10)?
Tobiah, one who opposed Nehemiah was from what background (Neh 2:10)?
When did Nehemiah initially survey the broken down walls of Jerusalem (Neh 2:13)?
What had Nehemiah not told anyone (Neh 2:12)?
choice: What God had put in his heart to do for Jerusalem
What Artaxerxes had given him permission to do in Jerusalem
That he had orders from the Persian king
How he planned to restore the temple

question: How many days was Nehemiah in Jerusalem before he began to survey its walls (Neh 2:11)?
Through what gate did Nehemiah exit Jerusalem at night in order to survey the broken down walls (Neh 2:13)?
After exiting Jerusalem to survey the walls at night where did Nehemiah head to (Neh 2:13)?
After exiting Jerusalem to survey the walls at night where did Nehemiah head to (Neh 2:13)?
At night what did Nehemiah survey around Jerusalem (Neh 2:13)?
choice: The walls that had been broken down

question: At night what did Nehemiah survey around Jerusalem (Neh 2:13)?
choice: The gates that had been burned

question: What happened when Nehemiah moved toward the Fountain Gate (Neh 2:14)?
choice: The gate could not be opened and had to be forced open
There was not enough room for his horse to get through

question: Where was there not enough room for Nehemiah’s horse to get through (Neh 2:14)?
choice: At the Dung Gate and the Jackal Well
Toward the Fountain Gate and the King’s Pool
Beside the Spring of En Rogel and Warren’s Shaft
Beside the walls of the Hinnom Valley and Zion Gate

question: After his night survey of the wall of Jerusalem what gate did Nehemiah reenter the city (Neh 2:15)?
All of the following groups are pointed out as having no knowledge of what Nehemiah was doing after he surveyed the broken walls of Jerusalem at night EXCEPT (Neh 2:16)
What did Nehemiah propose in order to remove the disgrace the returned exiles were feeling (Neh 2:17)?
choice: Let us rebuild the walls of Jerusalem
Let us return to the Lord
Let us put away all idols and follow the Lord
Let us rebuild the temple of the Lord

question: Besides how the gracious hand of the Lord was upon him what else did Nehemiah tell the leaders about when he called them to rebuild the walls (Neh 2:18)?
choice: Exactly where the walls were broken down
How he had secured timbers from the king’s forest
What the king had said to him
What the prophet Iddo the seer had prophesied

question: When all of the following people heard of what Nehemiah proposed to do they all mocked EXCEPT (Neh 2:19)
What did Sanballat, Tobiah and Geshem do when they heard of what Nehemiah was planning on doing (Neh 2:19)?
choice: They began to tear down the walls further
They set up traps to halt the work

question: Of what did Sanballat, Tobiah and Geshem accuse Nehemiah (Neh 2:19)?
choice: Trying to kill them and their families

question: How did Nehemiah answer Sanballat’s ridiculing his efforts to rebuild Jerusalem (Neh 2:20)?
choice: You and your companions will be defeated
God will show you a sign that he is for us
In three days waters will flow in Jerusalem
The God of heaven will give us success

question: Who was the high priest during the time Nehemiah was attempting to rebuild the walls of Jerusalem (Neh 3:1)?
What gate did Eliashib the high priest and his fellow priests rebuild (Neh 3:1)?
To what two towers did Eliashib the high priests and his fellow priests rebuild (Neh 3:1)?
choice: The Tower of the Hundred and the Tower of Hananel
The Tower of Elishamah and the Corner Tower
The Tower of the Priests and the Gihon Tower
The Corner Tower and the Tower of Tekoa

question: Who built next to Eliashib the high priest (Neh 3:2)?
What did the sons of Hassenaah rebuild (Neh 3:3)?
All of the following were listed as part of the rebuilding of the Fish Gate by the sons of Hassenaah EXCEPT (Neh 3:3)?
The nobles of what town in Judah would not put their shoulders to work under their supervisors (Neh 3:5)?
Joiada and Meshullam rebuilt what gate (Neh 3:6)?
What contributors to rebuilding were under the authority of the governor of Trans- Euphrates (Neh 3:7)?
Uzziel son of Harhaiah was original a(n) _________ (Neh 3:8)?
What was Hananiah prior to his work on the repairs of Jerusalem (Neh 3:8)?
Hananiah repaired Jerualem as far as the _________ wall (Neh 3:8)?
Rephiah played what function in Jerusalem (Neh 3:9)?
choice: Ruler of a half-district of Jerusalem

question: What repairs did Jedaiah son of Harumaph make (Neh 3:10)?
Hasshub son of Pahath-Moab repaired what tower (Neh 3:11)?
Who helped Shallum ruler of a half-district of Jerusalem (Neh 3:12)?
Hanun and the residents of Zanoah repaired the Valley Gate and the wall as far as what other gate (Neh 3:13)?
The ruler of the district of Beth Hakkerem rebuilt what gate (Neh 3:14)?
Shallun the ruler of the district of Mizpah rebuilt what gate (Neh 3:15)?
Shallun the ruler of the district of Mizpah rebuilt the wall of what pool (Neh 3:15)?
The Pool of Siloam was near what other identified Jerusalem location (Neh 3:15)?
Nehemiah from Beth Zur did the repairs opposite the tombs of David and what house (Neh 3:16)?
choice: The House of the sons of Korah

question: Nehemiah from Beth Zur did the repairs on the House of Heroes and also opposite ___________ (Neh 3:16)?
What city had two representatives both rulers of half districts contribute to the rebuilding of the walls of Jerusalem (Neh 3:17f)?
Baruch zealously repaired from the angle to __________ (Neh 3:20)?
choice: The house of Eliashib the high priest
The house of Nergal the Persian governor

question: Binnui repaired from his house to the _______ and the corner (Neh 3:24)?
Palal worked opposite the angle and the ___________ (Neh 3:25)
What was near the upper palace (Neh 3:25)?
On what hill did the temple servants live (Neh 3:26)?
What gate was near the projecting tower (Neh 3:26)?
The priests made repairs by their own homes of what gate (Neh 3:28)?
Shemiah son of Shecaniah was the guard of what gate (Neh 3:29)?
The house of the temple servants and merchants was opposite what gate (Neh 3:31)?
Up to what gate did the goldsmiths and merchants make repairs (Neh 3:32)?
Who became angry and incensed when he heard the wall of Jerusalem was being rebuilt (Neh 4:1)?
Sanballat ridiculed the Jews in front of what army (Neh 4:2)?
What part of the ruins of Jerusalem did Sanballat mock saying they would not be able to bring them back to life (Neh 4:2)?
Tobiah the Ammonite mocked the Jews what kind of animal would easily break down the walls of stones the Jews were building (Neh 4:3)?
What did Nehemiah pray would be turned back on the heads of Sanballat and Tobiah (Neh 4:4)?
What did Nehemiah pray would happen to Sanballat and Tobiah (Neh 4:4)?
choice: They would be given as plunder in a land of captivity
They would become like dust swept out of a house as worthless
They would become like chaff blown away by the wind
They would become like dung despised by all

question: What did Nehemiah pray God would not do for Sanballat and Tobiah (Neh 4:5)?
choice: Protect them from the armies of Artaxerxes

question: What did Nehemiah pray God would not cover for Sanballat and Tobiah (Neh 4:5)?
Until the wall was half built how did Nehemiah describe how the people worked (Neh 4:6)?
choice: They put their shoulders to the harness
They gave it all they had
They worked with all their heart

question: How high was the wall built by the people with all their heart (Neh 4:6)?
choice: All the wall was half height
The wall was completed from the Water Gate to the Sheep Gate
The first course of stones were laid

question: When did Sanballat and Tobiah plot to fight against Jerusalem (Neh 4:7)?
choice: When they heard the foundations of the walls were completed
When they heard the gates had been rebuilt
When they heard that the gaps were being closed
When they heard the Water Gate was completed

question: All of the following joined Sanballat in plotting to attack Jerusalem  EXCEPT (Neh 4:7)
When Sanballat heard the gaps in the walls of Jerusalem were being closed what did he do (Neh 4:8)?
choice: He and others plotted to attack Jerusalem
He sent his men to discourage the Jews
He brought his horses to tear it down and burn its gates

question: What was Nehemiah’s response to the threats of attack by Sanballat and Tobiah (Neh 4:9)?
choice: He sent word to King Artaxerxes

question: Why did the people in Judah say the wall could not be rebuilt (Neh 4:10)?
choice: They did not have enough people
They did not have time to farm their fields

question: What did the people of Judah say was giving out when the wall was half built (Neh 4:10)?
What did the Jews who lived by their enemies tell Nehemiah ten times over (Neh 4:12)?
choice: You must stop the work on the walls or they will burn it down
They are too many for us
They are going to attack us this very night
Wherever you turn, they will attack you

question: Where did Nehemiah station people to ward off the attacks from Sanballat and Tobiah (Neh 4:13)?
choice: At the lowest points of the wall
At the gates of the city
At the towers on the walls
By the springs of the city

question: Nehemiah stationed his people in defense of the exposed points of the city with all of the following weapons EXCEPT (Neh 4:13)?
When encouraging his nobles, officals and the people what two adjectives did Nehemiah use in reference to God (Neh 4:14)?
choice: Slow to anger and abounding in mercy

question: Nehemiah told his people they were to fight for all of the following EXCEPT (Neh 4:14)
What happened to the plot to attack by Sanballat and Tobiah (Neh 4:15)?
choice: King Artaxerxes sent troops to defend the workers

question: After the plot of Sanballat was exposed how did Nehemiah organize his workers (Neh 4:16)?
choice: Half did the work and half were equipped with weapons
The soldiers guarded those who were doing the work on the wall
The people guarded the priests who were building the wall
The men were on guard while the women and children built

question: What did each worker on the wall have with him after the plot of Sanballat (Neh 4:18)?
How did the workers carrying material respond the the plot of Sanballat (Neh 4:17)?
choice: They put the materials on cart to transport it to Jerusalem
They used their spears to carry the materials
They worked with one hand with the other on their weapon
They worked in shifts some working and others on guard

question: Who stayed with Nehemiah while the workers worked with their swords at their sides (Neh 4:18)?
choice: The elders and officials of Judah
The man who sounded the trumpet

question: Who did Nehemiah say would fight for them as they built the wall (Neh 4:20)?
choice: Eliashib and the warriors of Benjamin

question: What problem did Nehemiah identify as far as defense when Nehemiah talked to the officials and nobles in relation to Sanballat’s plot (Neh 4:19)?
choice: They were separated and spread out
The towers had not yet been built
The gates of the city had been destroyed
There was no water source inside the city

question: What were the people to do when they heard the sound of the trumpet (Neh 4:20)?
How long did the builders continue the work each day (Neh 4:21)?
choice: From the first light of dawn until the stars came out
They never quit but built day and night
They worked from sunrise until noon and then again after the heat of the day

question: Where did Nehemiah order the workmen and their helpers to stay for the night (Neh 4:22)?
choice: In the palace of the guard
In the gates of the city

question: What did the workmen do at night (Neh 4:22)?
choice: They prepared the stones for the next day

question: What did Nehemiah and his brothers and guards not do (Neh 4:23)?
choice: Set up guard posts on Mount Zion
Closed the gates of the city every night

question: What did Nehemiah and his men have even when they went to water (Neh 4:23)?
Why did the men and their wives raise an outcry against their Jewish brothers (Neh 5:1f)?
choice: They needed more water for their fields
They needed to get grain for food
They were put outside the city walls

question: Why were the people mortgaging their fields (Neh 5:3)?
choice: Because the wealthy were buying them up
Because they had no homes to live in
Because they needed to purchase grain
Because they were outside the walls of Jerusalem

question: The poor people had to mortgage all of the following EXCEPT (Neh 5:3)
Why did the poor people not have grain (Neh 5:3)?
choice: Because their fields had been burned by Sanballat and Tobiah
Because they could not farm outside the city walls
Because the Egyptian had stolen all their food

question: What did some of the poor have to do in order to pay the knig’s tax (Neh 5:4f)?
choice: Cut down the trees on their land
Sell all their grain to the king
Give up the inheritance of their fathers

question: Why did the poor have to sell their children into slavery (Neh 5:4f)?
choice: In order to pay the king’s tax
To pay for guards to protect their fields
Because they had no food to feed them
To stop them from being killed by Sanballat

question: Why were the poor people powerless to stop their children from being enslaved (Neh 5:5)?
choice: Because Tobiah had taken all their money
Because all their money was spent rebuilding the walls
Because their fields and vineyards belonged to others
Because they had no spears and swords

question: Why was Nehemiah angry at the nobles and officials (Neh 5:7)?
choice: Because they had no compassion and generousity toward the poor
Because they were exacting usury from their own countrymen
Because they failed to protect the poor
Because they were robbing the lands of the poor

question: What was Nehemiah’s response to the outcry of the poor (Neh 5:6)?
choice: He set up courts to give them justice

question: From whom did Nehemiah say the nobles had bought back their Jewish brothers (Neh 5:8)?
What was the nobles response to Nehemiah’s accusations of their enslaving their brothers (Neh 5:8)?
choice: They were silent having nothing to say
They walked out of Nehemiah’s presence
They shouted at Nehemiah in anger
They tore their robes and put dust on their heads

question: In what did Nehemiah say the nobles should walk (Neh 5:9)?
choice: In the fear of our God

question: What did Nehemiah do to show the nobles an example of what they should have done (Neh 5:10)?
choice: Inviting them into his home and feeding them
Lending them money and grain without usury

question: What amount of usury were the nobles to return to the poor people that they had exacted from them (Neh 5:11)?
choice: One shekel for the temple tax

question: Nehemiah told the nobles to give back to the poor all of the following EXCEPT (Neh 5:11)
What was the response of the nobles to Nehemiah’s demand that they return the fields that they had taken/bought from the poor (Neh 5:12)?
choice: They asked for a delay in implementing it
They denied having taken the fields of the poor

question: Who did Nehemiah summon in order for the nobles to take an oath (Neh 5:12)?
What did Nehemiah do as a curse sign when the nobles were taking their oath to help the poor (Neh 5:13)?
choice: He put dust on his head
He broke a pot in front the nobles
He dug a pit in the ground
He shook out the folds of his robe

question: What did Nehemiah shaking the folds out of his robe symbolize as a sign act (Neh 5:13)?
choice: God would shake the dust off his feet and reject them
God would shake out the possessions of anyone not keeping his promise
God would bring dust on the heads of anyone who harmed the poor
The person breaking his promise would have no clothes left to shake

question: After Nehemiah made the nobles make an oath about helping the poor how did the whole assembly respond (Neh 5:13)?
choice: As you have said so we will do
They offered sacrifices to the Lord
They cut their hair in a vow

question: In what year of Artaxerxes what Nehemiah appointed governor of Judah (Neh 5:14)?
Who was the Persian king who made Nehemiah governor of the land of Judah (Neh 5:14)?
What did Nehemiah and his brothers not do for twelve years (Neh 5:14)?
choice: Not request soldiers from the king
Not drink wine or cut their hair
Not eat the food allotted to the governor
Not live in the palace of the governor

question: The governors before Nehemiah took all of the following from the people EXCEPT (Neh 5:15)?
What did Nehemiah not acquire for himself (Neh 5:16)?
To what did Nehemiah devote himself and all his men instead of acquiring land (Neh 5:16)?
choice: Helping the poor of the land
Work on the wall of Jerusalem

question: Who ate at Nehemiah’s table (Neh 5:17)?
All of the following were part of Nehemiah’s daily food requirement EXCEPT (Neh 5:18)?
Why did Nehemiah not demand the food allotment normally allotted to the governor (Neh 5:18)?
choice: Because the demands were heavy on the people
Because he did not want Artazerxes claiming he had built Jerusalem
Because the Lord provided for his needs
Because the Gibeonites and Horonites provided him with food

question: Why did Nehemiah say God should remember him with favor (Neh 5:19)?
choice: For all the suffering he had been through
Because he sought the face of the Lord his God
For all he had done for these people

question: Which of the following was identified as an Arab (Neh 6:1)?
When did Sanballat request a meeting with Nehemiah (Neh 6:2)?
choice: When the gates of Jerusalem had been completed
When Nehemiah was sending word back to Artaxerxes
When no gaps were left in the wall of Jerusalem
When Artaxerxes sent more soldiers as reinforcements

question: What had Nehemiah not yet completed when Sanballat requested a meeting (Neh 6:1)?
choice: Not finished the walls of the temple
Not finished the walls by the Millo
Not finished setting the doors in the gates
Not finished building the palace and the citadel

question: Where did Sanballat want to me with Nehemiah (Neh 6:2)?
Why was Sanballat wanting to meet with Nehemiah (Neh 6:2)?
choice: He wanted Nehemiah to give a good report to Artaxerxes
He wanted to make a covenant of peace with Nehemiah
He wanted to purchase grain from Nehemiah

question: What response did Nehemiah give to Sanballat when he requested a meeting on the plain of Ono (Neh 6:3)?
choice: How can I meet with those whom God has not approved of
You are only seeking to harm me and not help
I am carring on a great project and cannot go down

question: How many times did Sanballat request a meeting with Nehemiah (Neh 6:4)?
Which of the following did not send to meet and harm Nehemiah opposing the rebuilding of the walls of Jerusalem (Neh 6:1)?
What did Sanballat’s letter accuse Nehemiah of (Neh 6:6)?
choice: He was plotting a revolt  and make himself king
He had stolen articles out of the temple and sold them
He was building a palace for himself at the people’s expense
He was refusing to pay taxes to the Persians

question: Who did Sanballat claim in his letter that Nehemiah had appointed (Neh 6:7)?
choice: Priests and Levites to anoint him as king
Prophets to proclaim “There is a king in Judah”
Gate keepers to stop any Persians from entering Jerusalem
Tax collectors to collect revenue for him rather than Artaxerxes

question: What was Nehemiah’s response to Sanballat’s letter (Neh 6:8)?
choice: You are a thorn in my side
You are afraid now that our wall has been completed
You are just making this up in your head

question: Why did Nehemiah suggest Sanballat had written the letter accusing him of revolt and wanting to be made king (Neh 6:9)?
choice: He was trying to get Artaxerxes to stop the rebuilding
Sanballat was afraid of the Jews
He was trying to frighten the people into stopping the rebuilding
He was warning Nehemiah that if he didn’t stop there would be trouble

question: After receiving Sanballat’s letter what did Nehemiah pray (Neh 6:9)?
choice: That God would strength his hands
That God would be his rock and his fortress
That God would not listen to Sanballat
That God would forgive his sin

question: What did Shemaiah who was shut in his house suggest (Neh 6:10)?
choice: He should purchase 100 swords and 50 shields for the workmen
That he should take men and attack Sanballat on the plain of Ono
That he should  build a mote around the city outside the city walls
That Nehemiah and he me in the temple because men were coming to kill him

question: Who suggested that Nehemiah meet him in the temple and close himself off there (Neh 6:10)?
How did Nehemiah react to Shemaiah’s suggestion of entering the temple (Neh 6:11)?
choice: He said he would not go into the temple to save his life
He said he would not go into the temple without offering a sacrifice
He said he would  go but only if the highpriest approved it
He said he would not go until Sanballat breached the walls

question: What did Nehemiah realize about Shemaiah (Neh 6:12)?
choice: He was a bad advisor and his advice was against the law
He was a noble who cared only about himself
He was prophesying because Sanballat had hired him
He was a corrupt priest and had no respect for the ways of the Lord

question: Why did Sanballat hired Shimaiah (Neh 6:12)?
choice: To kill Nehemiah and do it without having to defend themselves
To trick Nehemiah into giving himself up on behalf of the people
To stop Nehemiah from rebuilding the temple
To intimidate Nehemiah into committing a sin and discredit him

question: What group of people tried to intimidate Nehemiah (Neh 6:14)?
Who was Noadiah (Neh 6:14)?
In what month was the wall completed (Neh 6:15)?
How long did it take Nehemiah to rebuild the walls of Jerusalem (Neh 6:15)?
Why did the surrounding nations loose their confidence (Neh 6:16)?
choice: Because they realize Nehemiah had the support of Artaxerxes
Because they realized Nehemiah was a great leader among the people
Because they realized that this work had been done with God’s help
Because they realized the strength of the people

question: Which of Nehemiah’s enemies had married into some of the families of the Jews (Neh 6:18)?
Who sent repeated letters trying to intimidate Nehemiah (Neh 6:17)?
Who reported the good deeds of Tobiah to Nehemiah (Neh 6:19)?
Nehemiah appointed all of the following after the doors were set in place and the wall had been rebuilt EXCEPT (Neh 7:1)?
Who did Nehemiah put in charge after he finished building the wall (Neh 7:2)?
Why did Nehemiah pick Hananiah to be in charge of Jerusalem (Neh 7:2)?
choice: Because he feared God more than most men do
Because he was faithful in all his house
Because he was a man after God’s own heart
Because he was a righteous man who walked in the ways of the Lord

question: Who was said to be a man of integrity (Neh 7:2)?
When did Nehemiah say that the gates of were not to be opened until ______ (Neh 7:3)?
choice: Just before the boys went to draw water in the morning

question: What was to be done while the gatekeepers were still on duty (Neh 7:3)?
choice: The sheep were to be gathered into the city
All those entering the city were to come in
All foreigners must leave the city
The gates were to be shut and barred

question: Who were to be appointed as guards of Jerusalem (Neh 7:3)?
Where were the guards to be stationed (Neh 7:3)?
choice: At their posts and near their own homes
At the gates of the city

The Book of the Law in the temple

question: The list of the returnees that Nehemiah found had totals according to _______ (Neh 7:8ff)
choice: According to when they were first taken to Babylon

choice: They led the people in worship
They chanted “for his love is forever” after each chapter

choice: Enjoy choice food and sweet drinks
Go to their homes in silence

question: What did Nehemiah tell the people to do on the sacred day the Law was read (Neh 8:10)?
choice: Go to their homes in silence
Choose this day whom they would serve
Send some food and drinks to those who had nothing

Because they trusted in the Lord God of heaven

choice: Because he was the chief officer
Because he knew the Book of the Law

question: What request did Nehemiah make to the Lord besides that God remember him for what he did (Neh 13:14)?
choice: That God bless his people Israel
That  God forgive the sins of Israel
That God condemn Tobiah and Sanballat
That God not blot out what he had so faithfully done

question: What did Nehemiah warn the men of Judah of (Neh 13:15)?
choice: To close the gates of Jerusalem every night
Caring for the Levites and the priests
Drinking wine when they were in the temple

question: What did Nehemiah see the men of Judah doing on the Sabbath (Neh 13:15)?
What were the men of Tyre doing in Jerusalem (Neh 13:16)?
choice: Buying the men of Judah as slaves
Cutting the cedars of Lebanon on the Sabbath

question: Who did Nehemiah say “What is this wicked thing you are doing—desecrating the Sabbath day?” to (Neh 13:17)?
To what did Nehemiah attribute all the calamity coming on Jerusalem (Neh 13:18)?
choice: Not keeping the feasts of Israel

question: What did Nehemiah order to be done on the Sabbath (Neh 13:19)?
choice: The people all appear at the temple
The gates to be shut until the Sabbath was over
The guards on the walls to not let anyone enter Jerusalem
The fields be abandoned on the Sabbath

question: Who spent the night by the walls of Jerusalem (Neh 13:20)?
How did Nehemiah threatened the merchants that spent the night outside of the walls (Neh 13:21)?
choice: He would send his guards out after them
He would put them in prison
He would lay his hands on them

question: Who did Nehemiah order to purify themselves and guard the gates on the Sabbath (Neh 13:22)?
What did Nehemiah ask God to show him (Neh 13:22)?
What did the children of those who had intermarried not know (Neh 13:24)?
Nehemiah lists all of the following places where the men he saw took wives from EXCEPT (Neh 13:23)
What language did the children of mixed marriages know how to speak (Neh 13:24)?
Nehemiah did all of the following to those who had intermarried EXCEPT (Neh 13:25)
choice: Drove them out of the city

question: What oath did Nehemiah make the people take (Neh 13:25)?
choice: They would follow in the ways of the Lord
They would not give their daughters to the foreigners’ sons
They would not violate the Sabbath
They would not harvest grain on the Sabbath

question: What king of Israel does Nehemiah focus on as sinning (Neh 13:26)?
How does Nehemiah characterize Solomon’s relationship to God (Neh 13:26)?
choice: He was a man after God’s own heart
He turned away from the Lord his God
God made him the wisest of men

question: What does Nehemiah say led Solomon into sin (Neh 13:26)?
Who was the high priest during Nehemiah’s days (Neh 13:28)?

Who did Nehemiah drive away from himself (Neh 13:28)?
choice: The nephew of Sanballat the Horonite
One of the grandsons of Eliashib the high priest
The son-in-law of Zerubbabel who had led Israel
